passage_text: Hi Kristen-Aside from my mortgage career, I've spent many years in the building field. A short answer on this-just for budget sake-is you're looking at a minimum of $10K to drill and install-and it could easily be over $15K as well. Many variables. You just won't know until the well company starts drilling.
It typically costs between $5,000 and $10,000 to dig a well in Virginia. The actual cost will very greatly based on the depth required to reach water.

1 This brings the typical total for drilling a well and setting up a private water delivery system to $3,500-$20,000 or more, but an especially deep and difficult well with a complex water system can cost $20,000-$50,000 or more, depending on depth, water yield and system complexity.

How much does it cost to drill a new well? It depends how deep they have to drill for the water. ANS 2 -In Canada it currently costs about $48 per foot plus a 'set up ' charge of approximately $3,500. - In my area an … average well is anywhere between 100 and 200 feet deep, so that cost would be $8,300 to $13,000.

We moved here from Northern Neck VA, and the last well we had drilled there cost us $ 7,200 but was 680 feet deep. Before that, our well (~ 330 feet) and septic (pump system for 3 bedroom) in Mechanicsville, VA ran around $ 9,000 - $ 10,000. I have no idea how deep drill wells have to be in this area.

1 (However, if the geological conditions are especially difficult or access is extremely limited, drilling can cost $30-$50 a foot or more.) For example, the sustainable Arizona homesteaders at ByExample.com report paying $6,750 to have well drilled 280' deep, or about $24 /foot.

1 Drilling the well hole, installing the casing (a tubular lining that prevents the well hole from collapsing) and adding a well cap (a tight-fitting, vermin-proof top seal) typically costs $15-$30 per foot, or $1,500-$3,000 for a 100' deep well, and $6,000-$12,000 for a 400' well.
